paragraphs.text: I'm a revenue engineer. I build the data infrastructure and automation systems that turn GTM chaos into repeatable revenue. I've built it for myself and for others.
paragraphs.highlightText: And I am good at it.

quote.text: Speed to Execution — you move extremely fast on your projects. Gathering information — you may be able to gather information about the current status of a situation faster than anyone I have ever worked with.

paragraphs.text: But I am by no means a natural. I don't have some God-given gift for engineering. I haven't been coding since I was wearing braces, and I can't tell you what Big O notation my code runs at.

I'm a founder who taught himself to build data pipelines because the businesses I was building demanded it. The only natural thing I have going for me is the tenacity to keep wrangling data until it does what I need.

When companies are spending $20k a month on paid and their cost per meeting is through the roof — but half the leads are duplicates or garbage — I build the pipeline that cleans the data so they can run proper exclusions, tighten targeting, and stop paying to acquire the same person twice.
When someone from a target account hits the pricing page and no one knows about it, I build the system that catches it, enriches the contact, and pings the right rep in real time.
When companies want to reach their entire market but their emails are landing in spam, I build the outbound infrastructure — dedicated IPs, proper warmup, domain configuration —

quote.text: Extremely hard-working. He singlehandedly stood up an entire system, handled hundreds of moving pieces, and didn't flinch at the manual work. He's not one to shirk grunt work even after months of long hours.

items.title: Data Enrichment Pipeline
items.description: A production system that ingests your raw data — CSVs, CRM exports, webinar lists, whatever — and outputs clean, deduplicated, enriched records in a queryable database. Proper schema. Normalized fields. Ready to act on.

items.title: Automation System
items.description: Triggers, logic, and routing wired together so your team stops doing manual work. When a lead does X, the system does Y. CRM updates itself. Slack pings the right person. No babysitting.

items.title: Outbound Infrastructure
items.description: Warmed inboxes, proper DNS, domain rotation, sequencing — the pipes to reach your entire market without landing in spam. Not a strategy deck. Actual infrastructure you can send from.

whoThisIsFor.heading: Who This Is For
paragraphs: Series A+ founders and GTM leaders. $3M+ in revenue. At least 3 salespeople. Already spending $15k–$20k/month on paid acquisition. Already paying for the tools — just not getting the results you expected from them.
ACV of $30k+ — so one new customer covers the engagement and then some.

whoThisIsNotFor.heading: Who This Is Not For
paragraphs: Pre-product. Pre-revenue. Still figuring out product-market fit. If that's you, this isn't the time.
I also don't do fractional roles, retainers with vague scope, or "embedded" anything. I'm not your employee.

items.title: Expert Calls
items.description: One-off calls for specific questions — Clay, tooling, architecture, whatever you're stuck on. You book time, we solve it.

items.title: Scoped Builds
items.description: A defined deliverable with a fixed price. Data pipeline, automation system, outbound infrastructure. I build it, hand it off, you use it.

items.title: Ongoing Advisory
items.description: A retained relationship for founders who want me in their corner. GTM strategy, systems architecture, what to build, what to skip, who to hire. I take on a small number of these.

cta.heading: Let's Talk
cta.description: If this sounds like what you need, here's my calendar.
